hook.text: Tibet was closed to foreigners in the 1920s. Anyone caught entering faced imprisonment or death.

buildup.text: French explorer Alexandra David-NÃ©el disguised herself as a Tibetan pilgrim to slip past guards.

discovery.text: She walked 2,000 miles through Himalayan passes in winter, sleeping in caves and begging for food.

twist.text: In 1924, she became the first European woman to enter Lhasa, Tibet's forbidden capital.

climax.text: She lived to 100, writing over 30 books about Tibetan Buddhism and Asian philosophy.

punchline.text: She walked into a forbidden city and lived to tell it at 100.
